meanings.definition: To change the order or arrangement of (a set of things)
meanings.sent1: I will permutate the books on the shelf to make them look neater.
meanings.sent2: She likes to permutate her schedule to fit in all her activities.
meanings.sent3: Trying to permutate the puzzle pieces only made the picture more confusing.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to permutate the memories, mixing up the order of events.
meanings.sent5: The magician's hands moved quickly to permutate the colored scarves into different patterns.

meanings.definition: To rearrange (a set of things) in all possible ways
meanings.sent1: The computer program can permutate the numbers to find the best sequence.
meanings.sent2: They decided to permutate the seating arrangement for the party.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to permutate the ingredients, but the recipe still didn't turn out right.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts seemed to permutate endlessly, exploring every possibility.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush seemed to permutate the colors on the canvas, creating a mesmerizing effect.
